description: What is diversity? Who is impacted by diversity? How is diversity studied? In this discussion-based course, students unpack issues on diversity relating to identity, power, and privilege with a particular emphasis on race and ethnicity in the United States. Students use theory and research from social psychology to examine individual, interpersonal, and societal factors that shape the way people perceive and respond to difference. Finally, students discuss strategies for reducing intergroup bias and inequality. Offered periodically. Also counts toward race and ethnic studies concentration. Prerequisite: PSYCH 230.
name: Soc Psyc Perspectives on Diversity
notes: This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
title: Social Psychological Perspectives on Diversity
